title: Renewable Energy Generation Operations Begin at Electrify America Solar Glow™ 1 - PR Newswire
summary: Electrify America has begun commercial operations of its 75 MW Solar Glow™ 1 solar project in San Bernardino County, expected to produce 225 Gigawatt-Hours annually, significantly contributing to reducing its energy carbon footprint for electric vehicle charging. The project is part of a virtual power purchase agreement with Terra-Gen and aims to support the transition to renewable energy for electric vehicle infrastructure. This initiative marks an important step in Electrify America's commitment to 100% renewable energy for their DC fast charging network.

title: Stellantis Invests in CTR to Strengthen Low Emissions U.S. Lithium Production - Stellantis
summary: Stellantis has invested over $100 million to develop the world's largest geothermal lithium project in California, aiming to produce sustainable lithium hydroxide for electric vehicle batteries. The investment includes an increase in lithium supply from 25,000 to 65,000 metric tons per year, supporting Stellantis' goal of increasing battery electric vehicle (BEV) offerings in alignment with their Dare Forward 2030 plan. The geothermal process employed recovers lithium from brines using renewable energy, thereby minimizing environmental impacts. The project is expected to create numerous jobs and contribute significantly to the clean energy initiatives in the United States.

title: Brown-Forman and Ylem Energy develop solar array for Scottish distillery - FoodBev.com
summary: Ylem Energy has collaborated with Brown-Forman to install a 630kW solar array at the Benriach Bond facility in Edinburgh, Scotland, which will produce 516,000 kWh of renewable energy annually. This initiative supports Brown-Forman's goal of sourcing 100% renewable electricity by 2030 and aligns with their commitment to net zero emissions by 2040. The installation is expected to offset approximately 120 tonnes of CO2 each year and includes Ylem Energy’s ‘Xchange’ product, allowing the distillery to export excess energy to the National Grid, thus reducing energy costs. This marks the first project between the two companies.

title: From Shirts to Insulators: Recycled Honda Uniforms Find New Utility in Vehicles - Honda Newsroom
summary: Honda has launched a uniform recycling initiative that repurposes worn uniforms from its U.S. manufacturing and R&D facilities into sound-absorbing insulation for new Honda and Acura vehicles. This program diverts 45,000 pounds of uniforms from landfills each month, contributing to Honda's goal of achieving 100% sustainable materials by 2050 through their 'Triple Action to Zero' approach. The initiative reflects collaboration between Honda and its suppliers to maximize recycling and promote sustainability. Over 380,000 pounds of uniforms have been recycled since the program started in late 2021.

summary: The Offshore Renewable Energy (ORE) Catapult and GE Vernova have signed a £4m research collaboration agreement to enhance offshore wind technology and reduce the Levelised Cost of Energy (LCOE). title: Aether Raises $49M to Extract Critical Minerals and Create Next-Generation Materials - WebWire
summary: Aether has secured a $49 million Series A funding to scale its platform that extracts rare metals and creates new materials using engineered proteins as nanoscale machinery. The technology aims to enhance resource efficiency and sustainability by extracting lithium from low concentration sources while reducing water usage significantly. Aether's molecular assemblers are designed to operate without harsh chemicals, maximizing environmental benefits. The company focuses on meeting the rising demand for critical metals in a more eco-friendly manner.
